decks.notes: This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also includes powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gifted Aetherborn to establish board presence and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently dealing with threats while generating card advantage through cards like Qarsi Revenant and Bitterbloom Bearer. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Mutavault and Bleachbone Verge to ensure mana consistency and flexibility in its spells.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption spells. By using cards like Archon of Emeria, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Skyclave Apparition to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also ramping up with Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure. Collected Company provides additional creature utility, and cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer offer a powerful finisher. The goal is to maintain board control and push for a fast victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard to bring back Arclight Phoenix and put pressure on the opponent. It includes a variety of spells that can help achieve this goal, as well as provide card draw and removal. The deck also includes some versatile creatures and lands to create a well-rounded aggro strategy that can adapt to different matchups. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently utilize spells and graveyard interactions to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while controlling the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also utilizes creatures like Ouroboroid and Sentinel of the Nameless City to apply pressure and maintain board presence. With a focus on resource denial and efficient removal, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and outvalue them in the late game, ultimately dominating the battlefield and securing victory.

This deck focuses on building a powerful board presence with Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, using cards like Esika's Chariot and Witherbloom Command to generate value and control the board. It also includes powerful combo pieces like Overlord of the Balemurk and Cache Grab to generate additional advantage. The deck is designed to efficiently disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Bitter Triumph while maintaining a strong proactive game plan. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Darkbore Pathway provide additional flexibility and resilience to the deck.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a heavy emphasis on dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It includes creatures with haste and direct damage spells to eliminate threats and close out the game efficiently. Utilizing fast mana sources and low-cost spells, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The strategy revolves around maximizing damage output and maintaining board presence to secure victory in a swift and aggressive manner.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Cori-Steel Cutter, and Emberheart Challenger while using powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the way and deal direct damage. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to provide card advantage and the ability to draw into more threats. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that enable quick, efficient plays, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by countering their key spells, removing their threats, and gaining card advantage through effects like Meticulous Archive and Consult the Star Charts. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value and a combat-focused win condition. Overall, the deck looks to grind out the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful threats like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to generate card advantage and maintain control of the board. Pinnacle Starcage and March of Otherworldly Light provide additional ways to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The land base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage to further disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck aims to assemble the Greasefang and Parhelion II combo to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes ramp and removal cards to control the game until the combo can be assembled. The deck includes support cards that offer card advantage and protection for the key combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly assembling the combo and leveraging it to secure victory in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 match.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly establish board presence and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. Utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, alongside efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with constant pressure. With efficient mana sources like Ramunap Ruins and Rockface Village, the deck can maintain its tempo and continue to push for damage. The inclusion of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Screaming Nemesis provide additional reach and threat potential.

This aggressive Selesnya deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan. With cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to slow down the opponent while using cards like Collected Company to generate a board presence. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides additional value and finishing power. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to help cast its threats ahead of schedule.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures, while also providing reach with direct damage from cards like Ramunap Ruins. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Screaming Nemesis help to disrupt opposing strategies and push through damage, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the game while gradually building up resources with mana dorks and land ramp. It aims to control the opponent's hand with discard spells and disrupt their board with targeted removal. The creatures are resilient and help stabilize the board until the deck can establish its control. The key is to slowly grind out advantages and outvalue the opponent while keeping their resources in check. The deck is designed to be versatile and adaptable to different matchups, while aiming to outlast the opponent in a resource war.

The main idea of this aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures, burn spells, and direct damage. Utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to chip away at the opponent's life total, while also using Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to remove any threats in the way. The deck aims to end the game quickly and efficiently before the opponent can stabilize, utilizing cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins to ensure a steady stream of damage.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control opponents' hands, while also using removal spells like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with threats on the board. The creatures in the deck provide additional pressure, with cards like Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid offering versatility in combat situations. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to enhance its control capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through a combination of disruption, removal, and efficient creatures.
